mavoClass.name: Mavo
mavoClass.description: `Mavo` is the main class. Every Mavo app is an instance of `Mavo` and `mavo.js` is the entry point of Mavo itself.

argument.name: element
argument.description: The Mavo root element

member.name: treeBuilt
member.description: Promise that resolves when the Mavo tree has been built.

member.name: dataLoaded
member.description: Data has been loaded (if any). Similar to the `mv-load` event.

member.name: element
member.description: The Mavo root element. Same element that was passed to the constructor.

member.name: root
member.description: Root Mavo node (always a group).

member.name: index
member.description: Index among other mavos in the page, 1 is first

member.name: id
member.description: Unique id for this Mavo app. This usually comes from the `mv-app` attribute. However, if there are duplicate ids in `mv-app`, then a number is appended. If `mv-app` is empty, then the id is generated from by concatenating string "mavo" and the app's [index](#Mavo#index)

member.name: inProgress
member.description: Name of event that is currently in progress (e.g. `"Loading"`, `"Saving"` etc), if any, `false` otherwise. Setting this triggers the progress indicator UI.

member.name: locale
member.description: The locale for this Mavo app, depending on any `lang` attribute defined either on the app or an ancestor. If none is found, the default is English.

member.name: autoEdit
member.description: Should this Mavo start in edit mode? Corresponds to the `mv-autoedit` class.

member.name: autoSave
member.description: Should we save automatically? Corresponds to whether the `mv-autosave` attribute is present.

member.name: autoSaveDelay
member.description: Throttle delay for autosaving. Taken from the value of `mv-autosave`, defaults to 0s if none.

member.name: expressions
member.description: [Mavo.Expressions](#Mavo.Expressions) object corresponding to this instance.

member.name: permissions
member.description: [Mavo.Permissions](#Mavo.Permissions) object that corresponds to the permissions in this Mavo (taken from its backend(s)). In the future, individual Mavo nodes may have their own permissions, but right now permissions are app-wide.

member.name: bar
member.description: [Mavo.UI.Bar](#Mavo.UI.Bar) object that corresponds to the Mavo toolbar for this app.

member.name: needsEdit
member.description: True if there is any property that may require an edit button (e.g. forms do not), false otherwise.

member.name: getData
member.description: Calls `getData()` on the root node.

argument.name: o
argument.description: Configuration object. For details see [Mavo.Node#getData()](Mavo.Node#getData)

member.name: toJSON
member.description: Serializes all current data as JSON
member.returnDescription: The current data as a JSON string

member.name: all
member.description: Object with all Mavo instances that are currently active on the page. These can be accessed by index, e.g. `Mavo.all[0]` or by name, like `Mavo.all.appid`.

member.name: route
member.description: A JavaScript symbol used to attach a property to `data` in `Mavo.Data`.

member.name: property
member.description: A JavaScript symbol used to attach property names or indexes into collections to `data` in `Mavo.Data`.

member.name: parent
member.description: A JavaScript symbol used to attach parent data objects to `data` in `Mavo.Data`.

member.name: get
member.description: Get the corresponding Mavo instance from an element reference, if one exists.

argument.name: element
argument.description: The Mavo root for the app whose instance we want to get.

member.returnDescription: The Mavo app whose root is the passed element, or `null` if none is found.

member.name: ready
member.description: All dependencies (e.g. plugins and polyfills) have loaded, but apps have not necessarily been initialized yet.

member.name: inited
member.description: Apps have been initialized. You can now use `Mavo.all` to get a reference to them.

mavoClass.name: Mavo.Node
mavoClass.description: Every property corresponds to an instance of this class, i.e. a node in the Mavo tree.  This is an abstract class, and is never instantiated directly. It's the class that `Mavo.Group`, `Mavo.Collection`, and `Mavo.Primitive` all inherit from.

argument.name: element
argument.description: The DOM element that corresponds to this node

argument.name: mavo
argument.description: The Mavo instance that this node belongs to.

member.name: uid
member.description: A number unique to this Mavo Node. Useful for debugging.

member.name: property
member.description: The property name of this node, if any. This is only `null` for the root node, any other node should have a property name.

member.name: element
member.description: The DOM element that represents this Mavo Node in the HTML. Same as the `element` argument that was passed to the constructor.

member.name: mavo
member.description: The Mavo instance that this node belongs to. Same as the `mavo` argument that was passed to its constructor.

member.name: group
member.description: The group that this node belongs to. If this node is a group, this will be equal to the node itself.

member.name: parentGroup
member.description: The parent group of this node. This will be the same as `group`, unless the node is a group, in which case it will be equal to its parent.

member.name: alias
member.description: The value of the `mv-alias` attribute, if one is present, `null` otherwise.

member.name: template
member.description: A reference to the first Mavo node like this one that was ever created. This is `null` for properties that are not inside any collection, or for the first item of a collection across all its instances. I.e. even if a collection is nested within another collection, there is only one template per collection.

member.name: copies
member.description: If this node is a template for other nodes (i.e. the first of its kind, see above), this will be an array of all nodes whose `template` property refers to this one.

member.name: modes
member.description: If this node is restricted to a specific mode (`"read"` or `"edit"`), this property will contain that mode, otherwise it will be `null`.

member.name: mode
member.description: Current mode, `"read"` or `"edit"`.

member.name: render
member.description: Render data onto this node. Calls `dataRender` internally, with logic before and after to maintain editing state, normalize data, and call hooks.

argument.name: data
argument.description: The data to render. `Mavo.Group` objects expect objects, `Mavo.Collection` objects expect arrays, `Mavo.Primitive` objects expect strings, numbers or booleans. However, any object will try to reasonably render anything you throw at it. You can read [these heuristics here](https://mavo.io/docs/migration).

member.name: dataRender
member.description: Inner function for rendering data. Subclasses of `Mavo.Node ` should override this function.

argument.name: data
argument.description: Data to render.

argument.name: options
argument.description:
Options object keyed by:
- `live`
- `root`: the root `Mavo.Node`

member.name: getData
member.description: Return the current data of this node as a plain JS object (not an instance of `Mavo.Data`). This is the data used for storing.

argument.name: options
argument.description:
Options object. The supported options are:

- **live** (`Boolean`): `true` if we want data for expressions, `false` if we want data for saving.
- **forceObjects** (`Boolean`): Force all primitives to be objects (which have a reference back to the Mavo node they came from). If `false`, only collection items are forced to be objects, and only in expressions.

member.returnDescription: The current data of this object

member.name: walk
member.description: Execute a callback on every node of the Mavo tree. If callback returns (strict) false, walk stops.

argument.name: callback
argument.description: The callback to execute on every node. It’s called with the current node, and the current node’s path as its arguments.

argument.name: path
argument.description: Prepend the path passed to `callback` with this.

argument.name: options
argument.description: Options object. Currently only supports one option: **descentReturn** (`Boolean`). By default, if `callback` returns `false`, the walk stops immediately. However, if descentReturn is `true`, the walk doesn’t stop, it just does not descend deeper.

member.returnDescription: `false` if was stopped via a `false` callback return value, true otherwise

member.name: walkUp
member.description: Execute a callback for each of this node’s ancestors.

argument.name: callback
argument.description: The callback to execute. The current ancestor node is passed as a first argument. If it returns anything other than `undefined`, the ascent stops and the function returns that value.

member.returnDescription: The return value of **callback**, or `undefined` if the ascent finished.

member.name: get
member.description: Get the Mavo node that corresponds to a particular DOM element, if one exists.

argument.name: element
argument.description: The DOM element to look up

argument.name: prioritizePrimitive
argument.description: If both a Group and a Primitive exist on the same element, the default behavior is to return the Group. Set this to true to return the Primitive instead.

member.returnDescription: The corresponding Mavo node or `undefined` if none exists.

member.name: liveData
member.description: An instance of `Mavo.Data` that keeps track of the data on or inside this node, and provides proxying and name resolution functionality to access this data, for evaluating expressions and such. Note that this property is not actually declared in `Mavo.Node`; subclasses are responsible for defining it.

member.name: children
member.description: An array or object containing all child `Mavo.Node`s of a Group, Collection, or ImplicitCollection. Not declared in `Mavo.Node`; subclasses are responsible for defining it.

member.name: propagate
member.description: Call a callback on each child `Mavo.Node` of this node. The node will also be `this` in the callback.

argument.name: callback
argument.description: Callback to call, or string name of JavaScript property on the `Mavo.Node` to call.

member.name: collection
member.description: `Mavo.Collection` that this node directly belongs to, if any. The `Mavo.Collection` provides itself as the value.

member.name: eval
member.description: One-off expression evaluation using this node as context. Mainly useful for debugging and/or plugins.

argument.name: expression
argument.description: The MavoScript expression to evaluate

argument.name: options
argument.description: Any options to pass to [`Mavo.Expression#eval`](#Mavo.Expression#eval)

mavoClass.name: Mavo.Group
mavoClass.description: Group nodes are analogous to JSON objects. There is always at least one group in every Mavo: The root. Any property that contains any other properties is also a group.

member.name: children
member.description: Object literal with child properties. The keys are the property names and the values are the Mavo nodes of the properties (which could in turn be other groups, [primitives](#Mavo.Primitive), or [collections](#Mavo.Collection)).

mavoClass.name: Mavo.Collection
mavoClass.description: Collection nodes are analogous to JSON arrays, and correspond to `mv-multiple` elements. However, the collection itself is not represented by any HTML element, what is represented in the HTML is the collection *items*.

member.name: children
member.description: Array with all collection items. Collection items are other Mavo nodes, and can be either [groups](#Mavo.Group) or [primitives](#Mavo.Primitive).

member.name: add
member.description: Add a new item to the collection

argument.name: item
argument.description: Mavo node, if one already exists. Otherwise, it will be created

argument.name: index
argument.description: Index in the collection. If not provided, the item will be added in the beginning or start of the collection (depending on whether it’s bottom-up).

argument.name: options
argument.description: Options object. Only current option is `silent` if we want the addition to not update expressions or fire any events.

mavoClass.name: Mavo.Primitive
mavoClass.description: Primitive nodes are analogous to JSON strings, numbers, and booleans. They correspond to property elements that do not contain other properties.

member.name: value
member.description: The current value of the node.

member.name: editor
member.description: DOM element used to edit this node

mavoClass.name: Mavo.Locale
mavoClass.description: Class responsible for localization. Each locale is an instance of this.

member.name: lang
member.description: Language code, based on HTML’s language codes, e.g. `"en"` or `"en-GB"`.

mavoClass.name: Mavo.Formats.Base
mavoClass.description: [Mavo Formats](https://mavo.io/docs/formats/) are implemented as classes that inherit from `Mavo.Formats.Base`. `Mavo.Formats.Base` itself is abstract and should not be directly instantiated.

member.name: parse
member.description: Converts a string of serialized data to a data object

argument.name: content
argument.description: Serialized data

member.name: stringify
member.description: Converts a data object to a serialized data string based on the current format.

argument.name: data
argument.description: Data object.

member.returnDescription: Serialized string corresponding to the data.

mavoClass.name: Mavo.Expressions
mavoClass.description: Each Mavo app has one Expressions object that handles picking up expressions and creating the necessary objects for each.

member.name: update
member.description: Updates all expressions in the Mavo app.

member.name: identifiers
member.description: Object mapping identifiers to JavaScript `Set`s of `DOMExpression`s that include that identifier.

mavoClass.name: Mavo.DOMExpression
mavoClass.description: A `DOMExpression` object is created for each text node or attribute that contains one or more expressions. Note that there is only one `DOMExpression` for the node even if it contains two or more expressions. On the other hand, if many items in a collection share the same Expression, they have different DOMExpressions.

member.name: node
member.description: The node that this DOMExpression is attached to.

member.name: attribute
member.description: The attribute of the node that this DOMExpression is attached to, or null if it's attached to the text content of a node.

member.name: expression
member.description: The original text content or attribute value that represents this DOMExpression, e.g. `"The sum is [foo + 5]"`.

member.name: parsed
member.description: An array of literal strings and `Mavo.Expression`s parsed from `expression`, e.g. `["The sum is ", expr]` where `expr` is an instance of `Mavo.Expression` corresponding to `"foo + 5"`.

member.name: update
member.description: Recomputes the value of this expression and updates the DOM with the new value.

member.name: output
member.description: Updates the DOM with the new value.

member.name: identifiers
member.description: All identifiers that appear in child `Mavo.Expression`s.

member.name: special
member.description: A static object responsible for handling special properties such as `$mouse` and `$now` and `DOMExpression`s that feature these special properties.

mavoClass.name: Mavo.Expression
mavoClass.description: Expression instances are created for each expression. Copies of the expression (due to collection items) use the same Expression object.

member.name: expression
member.description: The expression that this object is about, e.g. `"foo + 5"`.

member.name: identifiers
member.description: Any identifiers used in the expression. This is used to determine when to re-evaluate it.

member.name: function
member.description: The compiled JS function for this expression.

member.name: eval
member.description:
The latest value from evaluating this expression. Be wary of using this: since a single `Mavo.Expression` object can be used by multiple expressions, the usefulness of this value is very short-lived.

This will compile the MavoScript expression into a JavaScript function if it isn't already compiled, and cache the result.

argument.name: data
argument.description: The data to use as context

argument.name: options
argument.description: Options for MavoScript compilation, passed to `Mavo.Script.compile`.

member.returnDescription: Expression value or `Error` object if that produced an error

member.name: changedBy
member.description: The previous value from evaluating this expression. Be wary of using this: since a single `Mavo.Expression` object can be used by multiple expressions, the usefulness of this value is very short-lived.

argument.name: event
argument.description: Is this expression changed by this datachange event?

member.returnDescription: `true` if expression needs to be re-evaluated, `false` if not.

mavoClass.name: Mavo.Script
mavoClass.description: Static class with methods for implementing [MavoScript](mavoscript)

member.name: addUnaryOperator
member.description: Add a unary operator to the expression syntax.

argument.name: o
argument.description: Operator with a `scalar` property that's the unary function

member.name: addBinaryOperator
member.description: Add a binary operator to the expression syntax.

argument.name: o
argument.description: Operator with a `scalar` property that's the binary function

member.name: compile
member.description: Compile a MavoScript expression string into a JavaScript function. Using the `with` statement, variable lookups are made against the data in context and then against [`Mavo.Data.stub`](#Mavo.Data.stub).

argument.name: expression
argument.description: The string representing the MavoScript expression.

argument.name: options
argument.description: Object of compilation arguments. With the property `actions`, MavoScript actions are enabled in compilation.

member.name: unaryOperation
member.description: Intelligently apply the scalar function to the operand.

argument.name: operand
argument.description: Value on which to apply the unary operation. Can be an array, in which case it's mapped through the operation.

argument.name: scalarFunction
argument.description: Unary function to call or to map across the list.

member.name: binaryOperation
member.description: Intelligently apply the binary operator to the two operands. Either operand can be an array or not. If one operand is an array, it will map the operation with the other operand across it; if both are arrays, it will vectorize or zip across the operands, using default values for the shorter operand beyond its length.

argument.name: operand1
argument.description: First operand; can be an array.

argument.name: operand2
argument.description: Second operand; can be an array.

argument.name: operator
argument.description:
Object representing the operator, which can have several properties:

- `scalar`: the underlying binary operation, as a JavaScript function
- `unary`, `leftUnary`, or `rightUnary` (all optional): an underlying unary JavaScript function to call if one of the operands is missing; overrides `default` properties
- `default`, `leftDefault`, or `rightDefault` (all optional): a default value to use for one of the operands if it's missing

mavoClass.name: Mavo.Actions
mavoClass.description: Static, takes care of everything related to [data actions](/docs/actions).

member.name: run
member.description: Run an arbitrary data action in the context of a given element.

member.name: Functions.add
member.description: Implementation of the add() action

member.name: Functions.move
member.description: Implementation of the move() action

member.name: Function.clear
member.description: Implementation of the delete() action

member.name: Function.set
member.description: Implementation of the set() action

mavoClass.name: Mavo.Functions
mavoClass.description: Static, contains all functions available in [MavoScript](mavoscript)

member.name: _Trap
member.description: Proxy against which expressions are evaluated (via `with`). This is second priority, after lookup in data has failed. It's used for things like case-insensitive functions and unquoted strings.

mavoClass.name: Mavo.Permissions
mavoClass.description: Permissions such as edit, save, add, delete etc.

argument.name: values
argument.description: Name-value pairs

member.name: set
member.description: Set multiple permissions at once

member.name: on
member.description: Set a bunch of permissions to true. Chainable.

member.name: off
member.description: Set a bunch of permissions to false. Chainable.

member.name: can
member.description: Fired once at least one of the actions passed can be performed. Kind of like a Promise that can be resolved multiple times.

member.name: cannot
member.description: Fired once **none** of the actions can be performed

member.name: observe
member.description: Schedule a callback for when a set of permissions changes value

member.name: is
member.description: Compare a set of permissions with true or false. If comparing with true, we want at least one to be true, i.e. OR. If comparing with false, we want ALL to be false, i.e. NOR.

member.name: onchange
member.description: Monitor all changes on all permissions.

argument.name: callback
argument.description: Called on any permission change. Its context will be this `Mavo.Permissions` object and its parameter a `{action, value}` object.

mavoClass.name: Mavo.Backend
mavoClass.description: Base class for backends to inherit from.

argument.name: url
argument.description: The raw value of the `mv-storage`/`mv-source` etc attribute.

argument.name: options
argument.description: Options object. Current options are **mavo** and **format**.

member.name: mavo
member.description: The Mavo instance that this node belongs to. Same as the `mavo` argument that was passed to its constructor.

mavoClass.name: Mavo.Plugins
mavoClass.description: Static class with helpers for loading or creating plugins.

member.name: url
member.description: Domain from which Plugins are loaded. Default value is `"https://plugins.mavo.io"`.

member.name: loaded
member.description: Plugins currently loaded.

member.name: plugins
member.description: ids of plugins loaded or loading via the `mv-plugins` attribute.

member.name: load
member.description: Load all plugins called via the `mv-plugins` attribute. Mostly used internally.

member.name: register
member.description: Register a new plugin.

argument.name: id
argument.description: Plugin id that will be used to call it via `mv-plugins`.

argument.name: options
argument.description:
Options object. The supported options are:

- **ready** (`Promise`):
- **dependencies** (`Array<Promise>`): 
- **init** (`Function`): Function to execute after all dependencies have loaded.
-**hooks** (`Object`): Object with [hook](/docs/plugins/#hooks) names and functions.
-**extend** (`Object`): Want to add properties and methods to existing Mavo classes (or override existing methods)? Use this option! Keys are Mavo classe names without `Mavo.` (e.g. `"Primitive"`, "Collection" etc) and `"Mavo"` for the `Mavo` class.

mavoClass.name: Mavo.UI.Bar
mavoClass.description: Class for the Mavo toolbar.

member.name: mavo
member.description: The Mavo instance that this node belongs to. Same as the `mavo` argument that was passed to its constructor.

mavoClass.name: Mavo.UI.Itembar
mavoClass.description: Class for the item bar that allows deleting, rearranging, cloning collection items.

member.name: mavo
member.description: The Mavo instance that this node belongs to. Same as the `mavo` argument that was passed to its constructor.

mavoClass.name: Mavo.UI.Message
mavoClass.description: Class for messages displayed to the user, e.g. errors, notices etc.

argument.name: mavo
argument.description: Mavo instance this message belongs to

argument.name: message
argument.description: HTML of the message as a string or HTML element reference or anything that Bliss’ [`$.contents()`](https://blissfuljs.com/docs.html#fn-contents) accepts.

argument.name: options
argument.description:
Options to customize the behavior of the message:

| Name | Type | Description |
| ---------|--------|---------|
type | `String` | One of the predefined message styles. Possible values: `warning`, `error`. You may find the `.mv-message::before` selector useful here to change/remove/style the text added by Mavo *before* the message.
classes | `String` | Class(es) to add to the message (space-separated). You may find `mv-inline` useful here. 
dismiss | `String` or `Array<String>` or `Object` | If the message is dismissable, what should dismiss it? Options: `"button"`: x close button, `"timeout"` (after 5s or whatever specified), `"submit"` (submit event — useful if the message contains a form)

member.name: mavo
member.description: The Mavo instance that this node belongs to. Same as the `mavo` argument that was passed to its constructor.

mavoClass.name: Mavo.UI.Popup
mavoClass.description: Class for the little tooltip-like popups for editing attributes.

member.name: mavo
member.description: The Mavo instance that this node belongs to. Same as the `mavo` argument that was passed to its constructor.

mavoClass.name: Mavo.Observer
mavoClass.description: Helper class to make Mutation observers more pleasant to deal with

argument.name: element
argument.description: The element to observe

argument.name: attribute
argument.description: The attribute to observe (`null` if none)

argument.name: callback
argument.description: The callback to execute

argument.name: o
argument.description: Configuration object with any extra options to pass to `MutationObserver#observe()`

member.name: sneak
member.description: Sneak some code past the observer, whether it's active or not.

argument.name: callback
argument.description: Code to run

member.name: destroy
member.description: Stop & destroy this observer.

member.name: sneak
member.description: Same as the instance method, but can be used whether the observer exists or not. If the observer does not exist, the callback is still executed.

argument.name: observer
argument.description: The observer to call `sneak()` on

mavoClass.name: Mavo.Data
mavoClass.description: Data object attached to each node, responsible for keeping track of "live data", that is, data used for evaluating expressions and such. `Mavo.Data` also includes a lot of logic for name resolution during evaluating expressions. This is distinct from the data for storing in the backend, which is simpler and is taken care of by `Mavo.Node.getData`.

member.name: data
member.description:
The underlying data value, e.g. an Array if this Mavo.Data is attached to a Collection, usually a string or other primitive value if this Mavo.Data is attached to a Primitive.

When `data` is a JavaScript object or array, it has some properties keyed by Symbols from `Mavo`:

- Under `Mavo.route`, the data has an object keyed by property names; each value is either:
    - a `Set` of property names of direct children of the current node, telling it which children to look into to recursively find properties with that name; or
    - the boolean literal `true`, if all direct children should be looked into, which happens if `data` represents a Collection.
- Under `Mavo.property`, the data has the property name or numerical index for the node.
- Under `Mavo.parent`, the data has the data value from the parent node.

member.name: parent
member.description: The `Mavo.Data` attached to the parent node.

member.name: stub
member.description: A global object that looks up any property accesses in Mavo's global scope of utility functions and special values.

member.name: update
member.description: Update this data object based on children nodes' data (if the node is a Collection or ImplicitCollection) or the node's value in the DOM (if the node is a Primitive). Does nothing in other cases. Propagates updates to parent if any changes were made.

member.name: resolve
member.description:
Resolves the value associated with a property name. If the property name directly exists on `data` then it is looked up and returned from there. Otherwise it is looked up among Mavo globals and other fallbacks in name resolution.

If JavaScript object data is looked up from a route or a node, it will be returned as a JavaScript proxy on which property lookups will also call `resolve`.

argument.name: property
argument.description: Property name to resolve.

member.name: findUp
member.description: Looks for `property` in `data`'s descendants (including itself), then in the descendants of each ancestor of `data` in turn, until the property is found.

argument.name: property
argument.description: Property name to look for.

argument.name: data
argument.description: Data object to start looking in.

member.name: find
member.description: Looks for `property` in `data`'s descendants (including itself).

argument.name: property
argument.description: Property name to look for.

argument.name: data
argument.description: Data object to start looking in.

argument.name: options
argument.description: Object of options. If the key `exclude` is provided, a direct child data object that is identical to `options.exclude` is skipped.
